CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. 18, reads: "Ammon Sports Award Night - More than 200 persons crowded into the Terrace Room of the Terrace Hall Hotel, last week, to celebrate the fourth annual Award Night, sponsored by the Ammon Center Recreation League.  Beautiful trophies were given to the winning team and players in the Ammon Recreation Slow Pitch League.  In the left photo, left to right, are: Constable Tommy Smith, vigorous opponent of juvenile delinquency and the most generous contributor to this Award Night, both financially and in all-around interest, and Frank (Fuzzy) Walton, manager, hold the second place trophy won by the Tommy Smith All-Stars in the league playoffs (the All-Stars previously won the league championship); while Kay Rainey, manager, and 'Jim' Weaver covet the first-place trophy won by the Parker A. C. in the playoffs..."
TitMainTitle: Constable Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith and Frank "Fuzzy" Walton holding second place softball trophy for Tommy Smith All Stars softball team, and Kay Rainey and Jim Weaver holding first place trophy for Parker A. C. team, at Ammon Center award night, Terrace Hall Hotel
